attributes.action: stop the Cambridge City Council from buying iPads, using public money.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
According to media reports, Cambridge City Council has earmarked up to £29,400 from their £250,000 'climate change' budget to buy 42 of Apple's latest gadget.

This is a blatant gimmick so that the council can justify buying new toys to play with.

It is understandable that the council want to avoid wasting paper, but it is incredible that they think that means providing councillors with flash new Apple iPads at a cost of thousands.

reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
